title: How to Have a Healthy Personal Care Routine

steps.title: Brush your teeth.
steps.content: Brush your teeth. Keeping the surface of your teeth clean can prevent cavities and gum disease. [1] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Use a soft-bristled toothbrush and a fluoride toothpaste. Brush at a 45-degree angle against the gums and in circular short back-and-forth motions. [2] X Research source Brush for at least 2 minutes. Make sure to brush your molars, outer tooth surfaces, and inner tooth surfaces. [3] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Brush your tongue.
steps.content: Brush your tongue. Brushing your tongue can reduce bad breath by removing bacteria and food particles. [4] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Use your toothbrush bristles or a tongue scraper. Some toothbrushes have a tongue scraper on the back.

steps.title: Cleanse your face.
steps.content: Cleanse your face. Washing your face daily will remove accumulated dirt, bacteria, and oil. [5] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Buy a suitable cleanser for your skin type. You can get varying cleansers based on whether your skin is oily, dry, or sensitive. Wet your skin and massage the cleanser on your face. Gently wash off the cleanser with warm water.

steps.title: Use a toner.
steps.content: Use a toner. A toner can further balance and replenish your skin by adding nutrients. [6] X Research source Saturate a cotton pad with the toner and pat onto face, avoiding your eye area. You can also apply the toner with clean hands, if you do not have cotton pads.

steps.title: Moisturize your skin.
steps.content: Moisturize your skin. A moisturizer rehydrates and softens your skin after cleansing. Pick a suitable moisturizer for your skin type. Use cream, or oil-based moisturizer for dry skin. For oily skin, use gel or water-based moisturizer. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Wear sunscreen.
steps.content: Wear sunscreen. UV light from the sun can cause skin cancer or add more wrinkles. [8] X Trustworthy Source US Food and Drug Administration U.S. government agency responsible for promoting public health Go to source Choose a sunscreen with a broad spectrum SPF of at least 30. Apply sunscreen evenly 15 to 30 minutes before sun exposure. Reapply sunscreen at every 2 hours, especially if you are participating in outdoor activities like sports. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Eat healthily.
steps.content: Eat healthily. Poor nutrition can increase susceptibility to gum diseases. Improving your diet can prevent tooth decay and gum diseases. Limit acidic beverages like soda and fruit juices. Food acids can erode the teeth enamel causing cavities. Reduce sugar intake like ice cream, brownies, and cookies. Bacteria can ferment sugar and produce acid that will damage your teeth.

steps.title: Drink more water.
steps.content: Drink more water. Dry mouth occurs when you do not have enough saliva to keep your mouth moist, which can lead to tooth decay and infection. [10] X Trustworthy Source Health.gov Online collection of health and fitness standards set by the U.S. Office of Disease Prevention and Health Promotion Go to source Drinking water can further hydrate your skin, and rid your skin of toxins. [11] X Trustworthy Source University of Wisconsin Health Integrated healthcare system of the University of Wisconsin focused on treating and providing support to patients and public health initiatives Go to source Drink 8 glasses of water. Set a reminder to drink water, or carry a water bottle with you.

steps.title: Floss after meals.
steps.content: Floss after meals. Flossing allows you to clean the tight spaces between your teeth and gums, which can prevent build up bacteria that cause plagues and gingivitis. [12] X Research source Use about 18 inches of dental floss. Hold floss tightly between your thumbs and forefingers. Gently guide the floss up and down between your teeth. When the floss reaches your gum line, curve it against one tooth, making a c shape. [13] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Floss one tooth at a time.

steps.title: Take a steam shower.
steps.content: Take a steam shower. Warm, steamy showers can increase blood flow, improve immune function, and ease muscle aches and pains. A steamy, night shower can also help you sleep. [14] X Research source Turn on the hot water in the shower. Close the bathroom door and windows to capture steam and increase humidity. Lower the water temperature from hot to warm. Go in and shower.

steps.title: Keep it short.
steps.content: Keep it short. Showering for too long can strip the skin of oils and moisture, resulting in dry, flaky skin. [15] X Research source Shower for 5 to 10 minutes. [16] X Research source You could time your showers with a music playlist or an alarm.

steps.title: Moisturize your body.
steps.content: Moisturize your body. After showering, you should rehydrate your skin with a moisturizer to prevent dry skin. Use lotion or oil-based moisturizing cream. Apply moisturizer within 3 minutes of showering to allow better absorption of the moisture.

steps.title: Repeat your skincare routine.
steps.content: Repeat your skincare routine. Cleanse, apply toner, and moisturize your face again.

steps.title: Repeat your dental routine.
steps.content: Repeat your dental routine. Brush your teeth and tongue.
